DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Nottingham Score Tubule Formation Score NottinghamTubuleFormationScore
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:A numeric representation combining three histologic reporting elements, tubule formation, nuclear pleomorphism and mitotic count, to determine the grade of breast cancer.  The Nottingham Score is a factor in determining the Nottingham Prognostic Index._The presence of malignant tubular formations which are thought to represent malignant counterparts of the terminal ductal-lobular units of the breast.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._Score assigned to the tissue sample depending on the extent of tubule formation

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:A numeric representation combining three histologic reporting elements, tubule formation, nuclear pleomorphism and mitotic count, to determine the grade of breast cancer.  The Nottingham Score is a factor in determining the Nottingham Prognostic Index._The presence of malignant tubular formations which are thought to represent malignant counterparts of the terminal ductal-lobular units of the breast.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:A numeric representation combining three histologic reporting elements, tubule formation, nuclear pleomorphism and mitotic count, to determine the grade of breast cancer.  The Nottingham Score is a factor in determining the Nottingham Prognostic Index.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

A numeric representation combining three histologic reporting elements, tubule formation, nuclear pleomorphism and mitotic count, to determine the grade of breast cancer. The Nottingham Score is a factor in determining the Nottingham Prognostic Index.

Property.preferredDefinition: The presence of malignant tubular formations which are thought to represent malignant counterparts of the terminal ductal-lobular units of the breast.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The presence of malignant tubular formations which are thought to represent malignant counterparts of the terminal ductal-lobular units of the breast.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
